Package org.example.unogame.model.card

Class Card

java.lang.Object
org.example.unogame.model.card.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Card extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single Uno card, including its value, color, image, and a JavaFX Rectangle used for rendering in the UI.

This class is UI-aware (it creates a rectangle with the image as a fill) so that controllers can directly place it in JavaFX layouts.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card(String url, String value, String color) throws GameException
      Constructs a card with the specified image resource path, face value, and color.
      Parameters:
      url - the classpath-relative URL to the card image resource
      value - the face value of the card (e.g., numbers, "SKIP", "+2", "+4", "WILD")
      color - the card color (e.g., "RED", "GREEN", "BLUE", "YELLOW", or "BLACK" for wilds)
      Throws:
      GameException.IllegalCardValue - if value is null or empty
      GameException.IllegalCardColor - if color is null or empty
      GameException - if the image resource cannot be found

    • Card

      public Card(String value, String color)
      Convenience constructor primarily intended for tests, where rendering is not required.

      The image and cardRectangle fields are not initialized here.

      Parameters:
      value - the face value for testing
      color - the color for testing

  • Method Details

    • getBackCardRectangle

      public static javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getBackCardRectangle()
      Returns a back-face rectangle that represents a hidden Uno card, typically used for the machine player's hand.
      Returns:
      a Rectangle filled with the Uno back image

    • getCard

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getCard()
      Returns:
      the JavaFX Rectangle representing this card on screen

    • getImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getImage()
      Returns:
      the Image associated with this card, or null if not loaded

    • getImageName

      public String getImageName()
      Returns:
      the face value of the card

    • getValue

      public String getValue()

    • getColor

      public String getColor()
      Returns:
      the current color of the card

    • setColor

      public void setColor(String color) throws GameException.IllegalCardColor
      Changes the card color (commonly used after playing a wild).
      Parameters:
      color - the new color to apply
      Throws:
      GameException.IllegalCardColor - if color is null or empty

    • getImagePath

      public String getImagePath()
      Returns the classpath-based image path for this card.

      The path points to the image inside the /cards-uno/ directory, using the card's image file name as returned by getImageName().

      Returns:
      a string representing the relative path to the card image resource
